results.title: Pre history of man: on the threshold of consciousness
results.brief_description: An illustration of Pavlov’s theories of how human skills and instincts may have developed from his ape-like ancestors. The responses of monkeys and their ability to learn and to work out problems are demonstrated, with their implications about human behaviour. Research materials used in this film were provided by the academic Ivan Pavlov and Professors Voronin, Gerasimor, Ladygina-Kots, Roginsky, Semyonov, Tikh and Yakimov.

results.title: Pre-operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates the method of preparing a patient both mentally and physically for an appendectomy operation. Shows the method of preparing the operative field for abdominal or bone operations.

results.title: Pre-occupied
results.creator_credit: Trish Carney, Victorian Women's Film Unit and Solrun Hoaas
results.brief_description: Using the device of a film within a film, “Pre-occupied” explores the decision to have or not to have children, while at the same time examining the roles and responsibilities of the documentary filmmaker. Cast includes: Victoria Arthur, Sue Jones, Samuel Krum, Rebecca Botelor, Greg Carroll, Carolyn Howard, Howard Stanley and others.

results.title: Pre-Approach
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Salesmanship”.
The methods employed by a salesman of industrial lubricants in making a very difficult sale is illustrated. The film emphasizes the need to acquire the pertinent information about a perspective client before the sales interview and adjusting the sales plan to suit the ideas and personality of the customer.

results.title: Prayers of a mother
results.material_description: Multi channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A video installation that centres around a mother’s prayers for her children. Her hopes and concern for her family are expressed through edited sequences of her children’s faces contrasted by a single image of her hands holding a prayer book and rosary.

results.title: Prairie wings
results.creator_credit: Edgar M. Queeny and Ducks Unlimited
results.brief_description: Each year sportsmen from many parts of America visit the flooded marshlands of Arkansas Grand Prairie in the quest for wild duck which abound in this region. Sportsmen are seen in action using artificial duck calls and decoys to assist the hunt. Much of the film is photographed in slow motion using telescopic lenses.

results.title: Prairie provinces of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of Manitoba, Alberta, and Saskatchewan, provinces which depend mainly on grain production for their prosperity, although mining and fur-farming are also important aspects of their economy. The processes involved in grain production, from planting to milling, are traced in detail.

results.title: Prahran the city
results.creator_credit: Russell Hurley and Prahran College of Technology
results.brief_description: Fourteen students from Prahran College of Technology in Melbourne collaborated on this project demonstrating a practical application of film school workshop production. Numerous aspects of the City of Prahran are blended together to create a film on suburban community using a probing television documentary style. Captures the changing style of business, once quiet, now busy since the influx of migrants; shows the ‘Feedwell Foundry’, the now defunct Realities gallery and the ‘Station Hotel’; traditional and modern architecture is represented in this city with examples of mansions, high rise accommodation and buildings by Roy Grounds. Community centres, a market and an extensive public transport network contribute to the city’s popularity which has attracted a large Greek population. Originally established as the Mechanic’s Institute in the 1860’s, Prahran College of Technology offers courses in business and art & design. The range of places available for work, rest and play all contribute to Prahran’s vibrant atmosphere.

results.title: Practising headsprings
results.brief_description: A demonstration of training methods for performing headsprings. Introductory shot of clowns doing headsprings in the circus ring. The remainder of the film is photographed in a gymnasium; an expert gymnast demonstrates practice movements for different parts of the activity and shows how these parts are combined in the complete headspring.
